Reviews.Title: “Good ...for what it is”
Reviews.Author: TomK_Chicago
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that this is NOT the Four Seasons. Ok, now that we've gotten that out of the way, I'd like to say that this is a clean, comfortable place to stay for people on a budget. I was in town on business, and I need to go 1 block to work on my project for a couple of days. The Holiday Inn Express of West LA filled a need for me with a convenient room and was just perfect. The staff was friendly and courteous, they had free Wi-Fi and a free breakfast, which if you just want instant oatmeal and a piece of fruit, works just fine. The bed was comfortable, although we were right next to the 405 freeway, so it was a little noisy. Bring your earplugs. The rooms also offered free HBO. Other than that, the grounds were NOT pretty...that's for sure. You can bet I wouldn't stay here on vacation. But for two nights, and for what it cost, it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks - it was great!”
Reviews.Author: AlperEger
Reviews.Content: Rooms: 4/5 Stars Food: 5/5 Stars Service: 6/5 :) Stars Thanks for the Stay, we had a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and expensive!”
Reviews.Author: SeanFromKent
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel while visiting a sick relative in Cedars-Sinai hospital nearby. Check in was very interesting as all parking is underground. When we pulled in, I parked in the first available spot (which was two levels down) then found out you cannot get to the one elevator without a room key. Pulled all the luggage up two levels to the lobby and check in was fairly quick. The room was noisy (ours was along Santa Monica Blvd) and the person on the floor above us apparently walks around in combat boots at all hours of the night. Breakfast was the standard HI eggs, sausage, cereal, bagels, etc. All of the rooms open into an open courtyard and I never had a safe feeling staying here. For over $200 a night (parking is extra plus all the taxes), I would stay somewhere else even if it meant driving an extra 15-20 minutes to where I was going. Access out of the hotel is right onto Santa Monica Blvd so it is a challenge in the morning to get out of the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE SCAM”
Reviews.Author: mtowndiva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights...my husband and I didnt have a problem with our stay our problem is....I will start from the beginning..first of all the gentleman at the desk upon checking in reiterated like 6 times to be sure not to smoke in the room because there is a $250 deposit if you do...That is not an issue for us because we DO NOT SMOKE!!! After arriving home (2,000 miles away) I notice that they have not put our money back into our acct...I believe in cleaning up behind myself so we left the room clean, towels in a pile all trash in bags..ect....So I call these people and they tell me they took our money because we smoked in the room...Did I forget to mention WE DO NOT SMOKE!!! The manager told me they smelled smoke so there will be no refund wow!!! These people know that people like us are not going to come back 2,000 miles to see them face to face about our money. I believe this is a scam that people like us get taken with no help...I called 800-holiday and they referred us back to the hotel. So I guess then they have just taken our money on the word that someone SMELLED smoke...I wounder did they ever think the smell could have been coming through the vents from another room?? Where is the customer service?? They win win because not only did we spend over $300 to stay there but they TOOK a $250 tip...I wonder who is splitting the money...hmmmm

Reviews.Title: “"Did the job"”
Reviews.Author: DG-Texas-123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night, while on a business trip to Santa Monica. The room and bathroom was clean. I had a room right on Santa Monica boulevard so it was a bit noisy due to the traffic, however, it wasn't that bad. Hotel amenities were fine, with the hallways being outside. The outside looked older than the inside, but to me the inside was where it counts. The free hot breakfast was done outside in a covered patio area. Very nice to eat outside and the weather was pleasant. In other times of the year (this was Feb), they may move it to another area. Food was ample and good. Liked the biscuits and gravy quite a bit. Pancake machine was cool. Overall it did the job, so I can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “good for your hotel basic needs”
Reviews.Author: sharee e
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here about 2 weeks ago just for a night on a business trip. Excellent Front desk service. Rooms are very clean and definitely up to Holiday Inn standards. Though not the typical Holiday Inns I've been to before, this one has an open interior. So when you go up to your room, you walk on an open hallway. I recommend this to business travelers w/ overnight stays or even long staying business trips. Not very ideal for family vacations as this is not a full service hotel. No swimming pool, just the basics. Breakfast is free, and I love Holiday Inn Express breakfasts! The pancake maker is great! WIFI is free, parking is $10 per night. Easy access to the 405 freeway, and it worked for me knowing how bad traffic can be in LA just trying to get on the freeways. Overall, I have no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “A bit creepy”
Reviews.Author: Cuse123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while on business travel. I wanted to stay under $200 a night and this was the only hotel in the Santa Monica area (well, close to Santa Monica) that fit the bill. Front desk staff nice and the actual hotel room was surprisingly clean. What wasn't clean was any of the hallway space - a concrete prison. Another major issue was the walls were so thin I could hear everything my neighbor was doing. EVERYTHING. Lastly, location is not safe to step out and walk down the street to get some food - restaurant selection was slim to none. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: karla014
Reviews.Content: Coming from a holiday inn in SD, I was a little disappointed when I got here. (I know there's a difference between holiday inn and HD Express,but this was notable) The building looks kind of old, front service was just ok. Carpets on the halls look dirty. Rooms are ok, not dirty but tired. Bathroom was good size but not modern. Breakfast was basic. Service at breakfast was non-existent, I had to knocked the door of the kitchen 3 times to ask for stuff. If you need to spend a night near Santa Monica or West LA and don't want to spend a fortune this is your choice, just ask for a room that not face the freeway or boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Location”
Reviews.Author: Roxy S
Reviews.Content: I was on the business trip for 3 days and was not quite sure about the noise level due to the proximity to the 405 freeway. I was given a room facing the freeway, instead of complaining, I gave it a try. To my surprise, the noise level that other travelers mentioned was not too bad at all. I am very light sleeper but i could barely hear the street noise. Room was very clean with adequate work space, free wireless internet, great selection of free breakfast food, ample parking spaces and fee is very reasonable considering you are in West LA. Above all, GREAT STAFF. I highly recommended this hotel and will definitely stay again even for leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “It's Nicer inside than it looks on the outside”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived and saw the outside of the Motel I thought I had made a huge mistake, but the room was nice and the furnishings were clean and appeared new. The room was a bit on the small side, but adequate. The biggest problem with this motel is it is on a very busy street. Traffic noise in the room was low, but access was very difficult. Motels in LA are a bit on the expensive side, so that was not surprising, but when they are charging you a premium for the room it really annoys me when they charge you for parking as well. The interesting thing about this motel is the center is open air. So the breakfast area is out doors but still inside the motel. It was a bit cool in January. The staff was very courteous, and they had cookies, fruit, and coffee in the lobby all the time. TV selection was very poor, internet was Motel average, which is a bit on the slow side. Refrigerator in the room, but no microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent management”
Reviews.Author: Hernandezmm
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean, breakfast is excellent. Management is great.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but not happy with Priority Club customer service”
Reviews.Author: sasandtim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a King room using our Priority Club points and were quite disappointed when we arrived and were told that all of the King rooms were full and that they only had Queen rooms available. The receptionist said that she couldn't really do anything for us and suggested that we call the Priority Club - that's where the Customer Service got really bad. The gentleman who I spoke with simply informed us that "as per their terms and conditions, they are only obligated to provide a room that accommodates the same number of guests" and that there's nothing else that they could do. I feel that they could have, at the very least, informed us of the change so that we had the option to cancel our reservation and choose another hotel and that, since we were using points rather than dollars, they didn't really care about providing us exemplary service. When I got off the phone, the receptionist apologized on their behalf and then offered us free parking (worth $10) for our troubles. Given that it was 7:30pm, we were exhausted and decided to just stay there. As far as the hotel itself was concerned, we were happy with it - the room was clean and quiet and we enjoyed the free wi-fi and breakfast which was included. Would I stay again? Not likely considering how many options we have in the LA area...but I will commend the front desk staff for doing their best to rectify the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Took some warming up to...”
Reviews.Author: csteen85
Reviews.Content: I'm from NYC and was here for four nights on business. First of all... it's not fancy. But it's a HIE, so you can't expect fancy. However, I was really surprised by the layout and exact location. It's literally on the corner of the 405 exit ramp and Santa Monica Blvd. AN ABSOLUTE NIGHTMARE DURING RUSH HOUR. It took me an hour to travel ONE MILE on Santa Monica Blvd to get back to the hotel on a Thursday at 6:00 pm and if you turn the corner too fast, you'll miss your only chance to pull into the parking garage, forcing you to have to go around the block and back onto Santa Monica to wait in another 15 minutes of traffic to get back into the garage. Pretty hellacious. I know this isn't the hotel's fault, but if you're going to be driving to/from around that time, you may want to consider elsewhere. Also, the hotel looks like a parking garage that got converted into a hotel. The outside looks like a building, but the inside (walking to your room) is basically open/outdoors. It's very strange. It feels motel-ish and a bit unsecure. It really isn't unsafe, I suppose, but it just feels strange to technically be outside when you open the door to leave your room. Unfortunately, I had a room whose windows face the 405 freeway. It was odd to be on the third floor and just see an endless line of cars. Nothing really pretty to look at, noisy during heavy traffic hours and if I had thought of it, I might have requested an inward-facing room, rather than outward. Also, parking in the garage (which has the most convenient entrance to the hotel lobby, but gets locked after 9pm, charges $10 per day extra. A few of the pros are that the rooms are clean and they serve some sort of free breakfast in the mornings on the patio/atrium/whatever it's called. You're basically sitting outdoors, surrounded by the hotel walls. I had no issues staying here, but next time I will probably request to stay elsewhere. The location wasn't very convenient for me and again... TRAFFIC IS A NIGHTMARE.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and room.........surrounding area not the greatest but ok”
Reviews.Author: jn1952
Reviews.Content: Booked this room for Rose Bowl trip as it's near my daughter's apartment. Hotel is a pretty typical Holiday Inn Express with excellent service and free internet and "hot breakfast". Parking was $10 per day but some other hotels in the area charge as much as $35. It is right off the 405 on Santa Monica Blvd so easy on and off freeway. Our room was clean and housekeeping was good. Plenty of hot coffee and typical HIE breakfast offerings. There were plenty of cinnamon rolls when we were there. :-) Scored an excellent, sub $80 rate, using Lastminutetravel.com. As others have mentioned immediate area surrounding hotel not the best, but far from "dangerous" and other side of the 405 is very high-end. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: jonnie711
Reviews.Content: It has been almost a year since my last visit here and this hotel is better than ever. Clean and orderly, yet comfortable. Friendly and competent staff who are always a pleasure to deal with; plus complimentary cookies, fruit, and coffee at all hours. What's not to love? Convenient access to L.A. events. This hotel is perfect for overnight visits to the city. Breakfast is included and I always look forward to it. If you need a place to stay in L.A., you can't go wrong with this Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: W M
Reviews.Content: If you have any reservations about booking this hotel... DON'T! You know that you had an amazing stay when the only thing that you can complain about is a slow elevator. Check in was flawless, the hotel staff was very pleasant. I've stayed at this hotel multiple times and this wasn't the first time I had received impeccable service. Oh, the location is a little rough, but hey, it's LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not the best neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: solotraveler721
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only one night for business and was not impressed with the surroundings. I had a heck of a time trying to find the entrance as you can only enter the garage from one side. Once parked, I decided not to venture out and walked to the nearby Luigi's restaurant. Once inside the hotel, everything seemed very secure and was exactly what you would expect from Holiday Inn Expresses. Not sure if I'll stay here again though if I have more time. I didn't feel comfortable with the surroundings for longer than a night.

Reviews.Title: “Another Decent HIE, Good West LA Location”
Reviews.Author: Tat3r
Reviews.Content: This is a standard HIE, but has a good location in West LA, right on the 405 (i don't like that road). Rooms seemed nicer than most HIE's, but a bit smaller. The one negative that they didn't have their signature crack cocaine,... err, I mean, cinnamon rolls, and assuming I was only there that one night, lied and told me the would have them tomorrow. The next day, no cinnamon rolls. The lady that sets up the breakfast, who barely speaks any English, gave me the exact same line (she seemed to know that sentence in English quite well, like she's said it many times before). I approached the front desk and was given some excuse about a hurricane (yep, BS), but recognizing that when someone doesn't want to do something, one excuse is just as good as another, I voiced my dismay and moved on. But seriously, if your marketing campaign hindges on billboards advertising huge pictures of cinnamon rolls, then you better have some @#&$! cinnamon rolls!!! (you see, it is like crack cocaine,... not that I would know). Other than that, I'd stay there again. One of the cheaper, decent places in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - I will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: SBMedico
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express West LA from 18-22 September 2011. The hotel is right on Santa Monica blvd where transport is readily available - buses pass there going to different areas including Downtown LA. The staff are very kind - from the reception desk clerks to the people who prepare our breakfast and those at housekeeping. Breakfast was a real treat - free with the stay - with lots of hot food including sausages and bacon and my favourite, pancakes. Although some said it was noisy there because it is near the freeway, I did not find it so. The rooms have good airconditioning and sound proofing. I will definitely return there again and will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Big_Bozo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 3rd Sept for 4 nights, Our travel agent stuffed up as we were suppose to stay in hollywood not in West LA. Deciding to make most of it we were impressed with our overall experience, nothing was to much trouble for Grissel and Sharon on the front desk, all the other staff were also very pleasent, the rooms were neat and tidy, the shower was excellent after a long day of exploring, the continental breakfast was a great way to start the day, the beds were also fine. Subway is across the road next to seven eleven, with star bucks just up the road, and the bus service at the door for your short bus ride to Santa Monica Pier, I must say I was some what surprised at some of the negative comments on trip advisor. Thanks again Grissel for all your help we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beds not comfortable, will not be back.”
Reviews.Author: lr0che
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an open atrium where breakfast is served, if you want to sleep avoid the second floor. The bed was uncomfortable and it just didn't measure up to other Holiday Inn Express hotels we have stayed in. Parking and internet are free, and the shower was good. With alot of other hotels nearby, will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG...yuck!”
Reviews.Author: beachlivin76034
Reviews.Content: First of all it is located directly under the freeway off ramp! There technically is no lobby. The hallways don't have carpet...it's open air on the ends. The parking garage is sketchy with homeless people walking around. The elevator was filthy. Not safe, not clean and I am by no means a hotel snob. We arrived really late so stayed ONE night. Checked out and moved to the Sheraton near LAX. It was a few minutes future away but there was NO comparison. I rely on tripadvisor very much, and for people to stay at the HI because of it's proximity to area attractions is definately not worth it. EWWWW.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RitaGurgaon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to LAX airport, shopping mall citadel, holly wood and Beverly Hills. There is a subway joint, an Indian restaurant and a mexican hotel nearby. Most of the restaurants offer you a door delivery. The break fast is sumptous but there is no variety. The same stuff is served to you day after day. In case you want to go to citadel, negotiate the charges of the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “excellent services”
Reviews.Author: IngridMM
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stayed over during this passed weekend with my family at this beautiful hotel. Wow the view was fantastic!!! Everyone at the hotel was friendly and willing to serve us as royals jajajaja. In a way this is also a thank You letter to all the employees in the housekeeping and front desk they kept everything so nice for us thanks and help us during our staying. Keep up the great job!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality Staff”
Reviews.Author: tiffanycherbert
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my family trip to LA, and there was one particular person that enhanced my stay at the Holiday Inn Express. Marieta, a lady who set up the breakfast every morning, was the highlight of my and my family's stay. Her positive attitude every morning allowed us to start each day with a good energy. Even when the electricity went out in LA, Marieta's smiling faced greeted us at breakfast to try and make the best of the experience. I look forward to staying at this hotel again in the future and only hope that Marieta or someone with a similar demeanor will be at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to Stay in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: jonnie711
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly and helpful staff. It's my favorite place to stay when I'm in L.A. I love their breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, with a good location”
Reviews.Author: YupiYey
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this place just for one night. The hotel is well located in Los Angeles, as long as you have a car. There's not much to do around the hotel within walking distance. The free internet was useful, The aisles are a little strange, as they seem to belong to a cheaper and older hotel, but the rooms look new at least. the only downside is that they charged us extra for the parking.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: vacationjason
Reviews.Content: this is definitely one of the worst hotels i stayed in. it was a bunch of guys and we had a few rooms there. we were there for 3 nights. the first night there were ants in my room. i think someone had left a soda (in a plastic cup) out. id like to point out that no one spilled the soda, it was just in its plastic cub. regardless, you should not have ants after only being there a few hours. the first day was the only day we saw ants. breakfast is in this weird tent that is actually not part of the hotel. it was cool in the mornings so we had to bundle up to even get a cup of coffee. there was a gym and a parking lot underneath, but both were super sketchy. i wouldn't even bother going into the gym as it was located in a separate, but adjacent part of the hotel. bums walking off the street could have easily gotten in there. as far as location goes, i think it was good. i wasn't the one driving so i never had to figure out how to get in/out of the hotel. LA is not the easiest place to drive, esp without a gps. you definitely get exactly what you pay for. this place was cheap in so many ways. i do not recommend this hotel for families, couples or anyone beside a bunch of cheap college dudes who dont mind the overall cheapness of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & perfect location with a car”
Reviews.Author: BeachPeattie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on our travels. First was straight off the plane from Sydney - and rooms were ready pretty quickly. For Sydney siders, staying here is similar to staying on Parramatta Road. You are on a gateway to everywhere with lots to do around here, but nothing of particular note. The first stay we had a car and being close to the freeway, it was perfect. We got great rates online which include breakfast each day too. The Hotel has a self use laundry and a gym which was just what we wanted. The rooms are really comfortable and the showers are absolutely fantastic! The rooms are really spacious, and my only note of concern was some noise from the passing traffic outside and from the air conditioning which we realised throughout our travels, was common in most properties. Free internet, and tea, coffee, delicious choc chip biscuits and fruit in the reception area make this s great value stay for people who want to be able to have a central base for a lot of LA while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: fanishsingh
Reviews.Content: Great value for money , good ambiance ,comfortable rooms and above all friendly staffs

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine, but...........”
Reviews.Author: JHROrange
Reviews.Content: I live about 50 miles south of West Los Angeles. As I had appointments two days in a row in the area, I decided to spend the night at the Holiday Inn Express off of Santa Monica Boulevard. The hotel is fine (although my room did not have a closet to hang clothes, odd). I agree with the breakfast reviews and, yes, ask for a room away from the freeway. I had Room 322. I woulld also suggest you stay off of the second floor as the breakfast area is located here. It is outside under a tent, so I would think noise could carry. They have a fan setting in the room, plus I always bring my white noise machine. I slept fine. The front desk clerk was very helpful. Now, about the area... 1) I could not figure out how to get into the hotel. Literally, you have to turn on a street called "Beloit" that looks like the freeway entrance to the 405 and make a quick right into the hotel. They told me they were going to charge $7 for parking per night, but when I checked out, it was not on my bill. 2) Yes, there are restaurants, a 7 -11, and a Subway within walking distance, but there are LOTS of homeless people. Did I feel it was dangerous? No, but it was creepy. 3) The traffic was horrific in West Los Angeles (Wilshire, Santa Monica Blvd). The nearby freeway location is actually good as it can take you more than 30 minutes to drive two miles to the 405. Also, if you want to go into Beverly Hills or Westwood (UCLA) to eat you will constantly be looking for parking and shelling out lots of money for it. In two days, I spent $33 to park in three different locations. 4) So, in summary, the hotel was fine for where it was located. It is the city of Los Angeles that is completely inept in not having any kind of comprehensive public transportation system for its citizens and visiiting tourists.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: ttna
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Do NOT stay here. Not clean, noisy, rude staff. You can hear everything that happens on the floor above you and the walls are paper thin. There are homeless people that approach you as you leave the hotel. We complained, called the desk at 3am about the noise. Finally we had enough. Then when we wanted to check out and move to a better hotel, they told us we would have to pay for the reminder of what we had booked for. AFTER we had already complained! Absolutely Ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “not so good, not so bad”
Reviews.Author: juillet_25
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because the price was cheap. The staff was good and easy to talk to. The room itself was big and comfortable. The problem was location. I had to take taxi everytime to go sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: akidcagal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the Nuart theater (Landmark Theater Chain) that shows independent films daily and the Rocky Horror Picture Show every Saturday night. We loved going right next door to watch movies. There is a Subway sandwich place and 7-11 right across the street and a few decent restarants within one block. It was about 15 minutes to Hollywood Blvd and about 30 minutes to Universal Studios. Also, the Santa Monica pier is pretty close. This hotel is upgraded nicely for an older building. Although near a busy freeway on on a busy boulevard, I did not hear much traffic noise in the room. The room was a good size and I loved the built in benches along the wall by the window. I wish we could have opened the drape all the way but in only opens in the middle. The desk was a good size with a nice plug in on the top of the desk for your lap top and/or to plug in a phone charger, etc. The hotel also has free wi-fi but we could not get it to work in the room so our usb cable came in handy. The tv was decent, not huge but decent. It was great to have a fridge in the room but there was no microwave. The bathroom was pretty nice and clean. There were a few minor flaws that the front desk seemed happy to know about. I waited until our departure as they were really no big deal. The housekeeping staff did a great job cleaning the room. It was even clean under the beds! The worst part of this place was the breakfast. We had to scrape the cheese sauce out of the mini-omelettes as it tasted like a bad copy of the cheese they use in kraft mac and cheese and it was very watery. The day they has scrambled eggs, they were super salty. The room is very cramped so it is hard to get your food if there are more than two people in there. The eating area is spacious but outside under a tent like area. The only fruit they had were bananas. They also had ok cinnamon rolls, toast and bagels, cereals, juices and coffee. On the day they had scrambled eggs they also had biscuits and gravy. On the omlette day they had sausages. I guess it was ok, but really they should omit the cheese sauce as it was probably the worst I have ever had. I never checked out the fitness room and there was not hot tub. But the desk help was excellent and they helped me right away with my requests every time I called them. My tip here is to join the priority club so you get a room in the back away from the street or get there early to get one because it could potentially be noisy. I liked our room, room 324.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient roadside motel, makes the most of itself”
Reviews.Author: jeanki
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a good stay here. It's definitely no frills in terms of its overall ambience and location, but it is modern and clean and maximizes what it has to offer. The front desk is very professional and pleasant. There are nice perks like fruit and cookies in the lobby and a free small business center in the lobby. The rooms are nice, clean and modern, with a very comfortable bed, and spotless, spacious bathroom. There was a refrigerator which is always convenient. They even left nice touches like chocolates, a greeting note, and a bag with snacks and water. There is a free 'express breakfast' in a central courtyard which is nice to have, a selection of yogurt, pastries, cereal and a couple hot items like eggs and bacon or sausage. Wish they had a little more fresh fruit there besides bananas. The rooms come off an open courtyard, so be aware that you may be exposed to the elements a little when you go to your room and to the covered breakfast area (we had bad rainstorms that week.) The free parking in a small underground garage is a real plus, because it's so much easier to go in and out at your leisure instead of waiting for valets and worrying about tipping and fees. The location is a bit unattractive, on a stretch of drab commercial roadway, but it's right off the 405 freeway which makes it great for driving off to other locations. (The Westfield Century City mall is convenient, only 2 miles east down Santa Monica Blvd.) There is some road noise given its location but you can try to request a room that faces towards a parking lot in back instead of the main street. The walls were a bit thin so you could hear doors slamming and some talking; but one great option is to turn on the low fan on the wall heating/cooling unit. It makes just the right amount of ongoing white noise, and I slept great as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed - a place to crash at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ImOnCloudNine
Reviews.Content: Finding something convenient and reasonably priced in West L.A. isn't easy and this hotel fit that bill perfectly. Staff was friendly enough, room was fine - a little small, but it was just for sleeping/showering anyway, and the location was just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and close to UCLA”
Reviews.Author: lleerph
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers all the amenities we need for an one night stay. It has free breakfast, wireless internet and parking. The price is right at the average range for hotels of similar type. But we love that it is close to UCLA and is located right off the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Bkfst, Convenient Public Transport”
Reviews.Author: AznArt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a UCLA graduation. The management is excellent with great and friendly service, breakfast menu with many choices and the best cinnamon rolls ever (warm too). The room was clean and spacious, nice TV, generous work space and wall benches to place totes and luggage, great shower water power, and nice basic amenities which included a shower cap. Free auto parking and convenient to the 405 Freeway. In fact, hotel is next to the 405 and noisy if crack open the window otherwise it was quiet when closed. Public transport is convenient and easy with bus stops within 1-2 blocks away (to/from LAX Airport, Union Station, LA Downtown Performing & Music Theaters/Hall, Santa Monica Pier). I enjoyed my stay at this location and wonderful service from the staff as well as free Wi-Fi connect.

Reviews.Title: “On the move”
Reviews.Author: seasunsounds
Reviews.Content: I had to bring a family member for a medical appointment at UCLA and it just so happened that their guest house and on campus hotels were over priced and booked. I checked online to find something nice, local and easy to get from point A to B. Holiday Inn Express was it. I hesitated because I have a preference for certain hotel brands but I was very happy with my choice. The room was very nice, and offered free wireless which allowed me to keep up with my office. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly especially Ina and Jason. Our room was comfortable and the fridge was much appreciated. The breakfast was quite nice, we enjoyed the cinnamon rolls and the soy milk was a plus for me being a vegan. Holiday Inn express appears to be on the move and trying to move themselves into a differen level of service and quality. I would stay here Again!

Reviews.Title: “We like it very much”
Reviews.Author: Shushush
Reviews.Content: A great location 10 Meters from the highway but still small land quiet hotel. The room was big enough with everything we need. Staff were great. Breakfast was ok. Parking - free. Internet - free. The price was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: fx772k1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and loved it. Check-in was fast and the staff was very friendly. The room (bed, desk) and bathroom were clean and appropriately sized for the price. The only negative was that the carpet was dirty. Since the carpet was dark, it wasn't visibly dirty. But it did turn my white socks black. Since I was only staying for a short time (and didn't spend much time in the hotel), I waited till check-out to make my complaint. They apologized and gave me a discount on my total cost. From what they told me, I was the only person to complain about the carpets, so I'll assume it was an isolated incident. The location is great, especially if you're driving (right next to 405). It's a short drive to either the Santa Monica Pier or Beverly Hills. The neighborhood is fine during the day, but a little sketchy at night. However, the hotel itself is safe and surprisingly quiet (my room was right next to the on-ramp). I appreciated the free parking, free internet, and free breakfast. The breakfast area was a little cramped, but the food selection was vast and the outdoor setting was enjoyable. Before I booked my room, I looked online at dozens of hotels. I chose HIE b/c the reviews were positive and the price was reasonable. Overall, I was pleased with my stay and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: saturncmc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight because of a business meeting nearby. I was a little nervous when checking in because the location didn't look so safe. I was surprised by my room. It was spacious, clean and cool. I walked to a restaurant to have dinner and felt safe. The breakfast buffet in the morning which is included in the price of the room was delicious. The scrambled eggs, sausage and coffee were great. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Different, but excellent.”
Reviews.Author: jimh316
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, a hidden gem. Our room was clean, the beds were extremely comfortable, and although our room was on the same side as the 405 freeway, the noise wasn't a problem. The only downside was that the room was a little on the small side, but certainly not cramped. Breakfast was very good, even though the dining area is outdoors, it's still undercover, and was quite pleasant for this time of year. The front desk staff were very helpful with information on buses and directions around the area. We booked a couple of tours through the front desk, and we were happy with the service. The buses along Santa Monica Blvd were regular enough, which meant that it was easy to get around, with frequent services to Santa Monica and Hollywood. There were a few restaurants around - Thai, Chinese, Middle Eastern, Mexican, Italian - and Delores' Diner, which we went to and had an inexpensive meal, but very filling. There is also a Subway across the street, if that's your thing. Overall, a great stay, and we would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a budget alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Blood on the sheets!...yuk!”
Reviews.Author: brain1076
Reviews.Content: I must say that the staff was very friendly. I commend the young lady working at the front desk. She was very accommodating to our requests. Now for the bad parts... The dead bolt locks on my door and the door of my travel partner didn't work. My travel companion moved to another room which was better and the door lock worked. It was a bit noisy as the hotel sits between an exit and entrance ramp to interstate 405. The neighborhood is very run down. There is a closed gas station across the street with fencing around it and multiple homeless people hangout at the subway restaurant next to the gas station. Most of the shops near the hotel have bars on the windows. We did NOT feel safe enough to walk one block to a restaurant near the hotel. This hotel realizes the danger as there are multiple security guards on duty at night. These guys are huge! While it was nice to have security, it is evident that there is a need for the security. These guys looked like they should be playing Pro football! My biggest concern was that after I slept in the bed, I found dried blood on the sheets on the opposite side when I awoke in the morning. Thank goodness I slept on the other side of the bed. This is an open air hotel. It is not enclosed! The hall way floors are all cement for weather. I travel extensively for my job so I am accustomed to staying in various levels of hotels. This was the first time I ever had doubts as to whether or not I would be alive in the morning. I actually barricaded my door since the dead bolt lock didn’t work. I didn’t get a lot of sleep and we left as soon as possible in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “all-u-can-eat-breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mraks
Reviews.Content: yeah the people were nice especially the filipinos. had a great 9-day stay there with us filipino policemen (PNP). the place was near sta monica beach, promenade, catholic church, best buy, yoshinoya, subway, fbi, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Could've tried a little harder.”
Reviews.Author: un4given
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with wife on a weekend trip to LA. We needed a hotel that was fairly close to UCLA. The hotel could use a lot of updating, new bed linens would be a great start. The evening staff was very helpful, mid-day staff could care less. No matter how busy things got, there was only one clerk. There weren't any decent restraunts close by, unless you wanted Subway. The odd thing was that there were TVs in the elevator areas that were 5X as nice as the ones in the room, I thought that was odd. They had a breakfast buffet that was better than I had expected. Just try to avoid the semi-boiled eggs, they were like silly puddy balls.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place! Definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: kerri3278
Reviews.Content: Went to UCLA for a conference with a fellow grad student (females 25 and 30). Had to find a place for around $120 because thats all our school reimburses but wanted to be close to campus and this fit the bill. Right off 405 on Santa Monica so convenient to get around. Hotel is just great! I love the setup, its like a triangle shape around a courtyard that serves breakfast (which is great and free!! crossaints, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, sausage, eggs, coffee, juice, etc). So all the doors of the rooms open up over the outside courtyard. It was quiet, no loud kids and the 405 didnt bother us although we were on the backside. The people that work there are just fantastic! We got there and they said someone canceled our reservation, which was an ordeal since we were using our school credit card but they made it all right. We had to call down to get a toothbrush and they delivered it a second later. The rooms are REALLY nice. All redone, comfy beds, nice bathrooms, nice furniture and decor. Very clean. The area around the neighborhood is a bit sketchy but we didnt have any problems. I think there must be a VA around because there were several older men walking around but none of them ever bothered us. Theres a 7-11 across the street, a liquor store on next block, and a really good japanese sushi place by the 7-11, looks kind of scary but it was GREAT! Theres also a cool little hookah lounge around the corner that was a good place to have a couple of drinks and relax at nite. Hotel was great location to get to UCLA, Beverly hills, hollywood, santa monica, and venice. And convenient to LAX. Parking is free and they have an underground garage. Good customer base. No views and no pool, so wouldnt stay if you are expecting that, but if you just need a great place to stay for a bit then this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: ALTF
Reviews.Content: My friends & I went to LA for a conference for 7 days. As the hotel of our conference was quite expensive per night, we decided to find another hotel nearby. We chose Holiday Inn Westwood at Santa Monica as the price of the rooms was relatively affordable for us and it provided free parking and breakfast. When we got there, we were shocked to see that the lift was out of order as our luggages were quite heavy. But, we were greeted by pleasant staff who offered to carry our bags up 3 storeys for us. Usually the rooms that are featured on the hotel's website is diff from what we see in reality. But we were quite impressed that the rooms looked exactly how we saw it from the website! It was very clean and the 2 queen sized beds were big. The room was quite spacious. It was also very heart warming to see a welcome card with ur name on the bed. They also gave us a small bag of goodies of biscuits & water. We were also impressed that they provided toiletries even makeup remover. And if you happened to forget to bring ur toothbrush /shaver, they were willing to provided free of charge. Breakfast was simple, egg, bacons, cereal and yoghurt. You can even pack ur breakfast onto a small tray back to the room to have breakfast in bed! Initally, we had a little problems with the price of the rooms as I had made an advance booking, I thought that it would have been the best rate. However, when it was closer to the date and the day i checked in, I found out that the rooms were much cheaper that the rate i booked online. The manager was nice to offer us the cheaper rate. I highly recommend this hotel as the staff there are very friendly very approachable and willing to help out in any way. It was a very pleasant stay there and i would definitely go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special, Decient”
Reviews.Author: jbwilkins
Reviews.Content: Rooms are Ok...all entries are from outside....free parking....neighborhood not the greatest, but I wasn't in fear for my life....

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Stay in West LA”
Reviews.Author: dwwilburn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to do a college visit to UCLA. It was a short trip to UCLA. Room was nice, staff was very friendly. Breakfast bar was good with eggs, sausage, bacon, an above average breakfast bar. Parking was just fine. Room was clean, linens nice. They are having some construction and staff wanted to find us a room away from the noise, even though we didn't ask about it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: RangeviewRay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in March 2008. Room was clean and comfortable, excellent bed and lots of pillows, large refrigerator. Continental breakfast was ample, dining area is outdoors so plan on taking back to your room if weather is less than ideal. The hotel is right next to the 405, our room was at the opposite end from the freeway and Santa Monica Blvd, traffic noise was not a problem. Parking is in their underground garage. Lots of restaurant choices within walking distance along Santa Monica Blvd, it is a safe area for walking. Front desk staff were friendly and efficient. We were very pleased (value for price) and will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week in December. Place is what the below reviews have said. It's a outdoor hotel with an outdoor Continental breakfast. Rooms are small, but updated and bed is comfortable. Overall its clean. You pay for convenience here. I had to be on Wilshire Blvd every day for business so convenience was important. Traffic is terrible in this neck of the woods. If you like a nice lobby do not stay here. There is virtually no lobby. If you like a nice breakfast forget it. You sit outside and have to cram through some sliding glass doors to get food with five other hungry people. But, it's the 'ol adage: Location, Location Location! It's fine to lie your head. That is about it

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: fionamceachran
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel, just off the 405, for 4 nights. It was very clean and our room was very nicely decorated. Noise was not a problem at all. The location was excellent - 10 mins on the bus to the pier, or 5 mins on the bus to Century City. Getting to Universal was easy too. The taxi cost $50 one way. And we got the metro and bus back and it cost $2.50 each. Breakfast was fruit/ porridge/ pastry/ cereal and quite good. I would recommend this hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location With Many Options”
Reviews.Author: fulgum
Reviews.Content: As anyone visiting L.A. has discovered, hotel prices can be outrageous to almost insane. That's especially true on the Westside. Having said that, there is one option that is actually a gem in the rough--Holiday Inn Express West Los Angeles. The West Los Angeles location is ideally located on Santa Monica Blvd and the infamous I-405 freeway. It's the perfect jump-off point if you are planning on driving. There is abundant subtarranean parking below the hotel with the rooms located on floors two through four. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. It was just me and the size was perfect. Two people would do as well too. The room was standard equipped with a very comfortable queen size bed, a desk for work or surfing the Net, high-speed Internet connection, if you have your laptop with you, TV with cable, a coffee set-up to brew your own and a good size individual refrigerator. I asked for a non-smoking room. The bathroom was a nicely designed, modern granite bathroom. It was nicer than some of the 'higher end' hotels I have ever been to. The hotel serves a continental breakfast each morning from 6:30 to 9:30 AM. For a continental breakfast, they serve a surprisingly varied number of items. In addition to the standard juices, they have bagels with cream cheese, hot cinnamon rolls, muffins, fruit, make your own oatmeal, hardboiled eggs and coffee. Those are what I ate. There were other things but I never got around to a second helping! The one downside....this intersention is notorious for traffic because of people getting on the 405, getting off and through traffic going to Century City, Westwood, UCLA or Beverly Hills. The building has clearly been soundproofed but you DO hear the traffic in your room during rush hour. It's not bad but if you were looking for a completely 'silent' room, this wouldn't be it. There are several benefits to this location: This area has a wide array of restaurants all within walking distance or a short bus ride away. Around the corner and 4 blocks South on Sawtelle Blvd is an area littered with Japanese restaurants, stores and markets. It's sometimes affectionately known as "Little Tokyo West." There is a multitude of restaurants including ramen houses, sushi bars and Japanese fusion houses. Stand outs include: Manpuku (Japanese/Korean BBQ) and Chabuya (ramen). By no means are these the only standout places! West L.A. is also littered with wonderful Persian restaurants. Westwood Blvd between Santa Monica and Wilshire Blvd is sometimes annointed "Little Persia" for its multitude of Persian restaurants, markets, book stores and other types of related entities. You don't need to speak Farsi to browse these stores. All people are heartily welcomed to walk around. Stand out restaurants include: Shahrzad Restaurant (Westwood Blvd near Ohio), Darya (Santa Monica Blvd near Bundy) and Javan (3 blocks West of hotel). There are many more. Other locations for a multitude of restaurants include Westwood Village, Century City Shopping Center, Pico Blvd between Overland and Veteran, and Santa Monica Blvd West of the hotel are among the areas with large concentrations of restaurants. The hotel location is also well suited for those that want to get out of their cars and take the bus. Parking is very expensive in L.A. and the notorious congestion goes without saying. There are several bus lines, however, that'll take you to a lot of the major destinations: Santa Monica Big Blue Bus Line #1 East goes up Santa Monica Blvd and then takes you to Westwood Blvd, Westwood Village, UCLA-Armand Hammer Museum and UCLA. Santa Monica Big Blue Bus Line #1 West goes down Santa Monica Blvd tp Downtown Santa Monica, Third Street Promenade, Santa Monica Beach/Pier and Venice Beach/Boardwalk. MTA Metro Bus #4 East to Wilshire Blvd. Catch a connecting bus MTA Rapid #720 or MTA Metro Bus #20 up Wilshire to Fairfax Blvd. This is the start of Museum Row and the Peterson Automotive Museum, Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA), George C Page Museum/La Brea Tar Pits, Craft and Folk Art Museum. So, in addition to being a very nice and comfortable hotel, the Holiday Inn Express West Los Angeles is nicely situated at a crossroads of sorts to many of Los Angeles' most popular destinations. This review only covered a few of many throughout this region. It'll be enough to keep you busy for three or four days!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, practical, functional”
Reviews.Content: This hotel was remarkably convenient. It's just off the 405, so getting there was a snap. UCLA is about 10-15 minutes away, depending on where you're going. (Driving, not walking.) Despite being just off the freeway, noise was no problem. I think it's double-glazed, and the aircon covers the little sound that gets through. I was pleasantly surprised by the room. It's a comfortable size, furnished with stylish modern built-in furniture, including a nice, functional desk. The beds were firm and comfortable. It was clean and well-maintained. The bathroom looked refurbished, with granite, tile, new shower-curtain, and Kohler fittings. From a practical standpoint: There is no closet and nowhere to hang a suit. I used the second queen-size bed in my room to lay out all the clothes that I would have hung up. There are big drawers under the TV set, good for clothes that can be folded. Unfortunately, they have been installed such that they tend to open if they're loaded. And I had to unplug a light to use the plug-point near my bed. Next time, I might bring a couple of hangers and some over-the door hooks. And maybe an ethernet cable, in case I get a room with bad wi-fi. And an extension cord. They had ample free parking in an underground lot with secure elevator access. The lobby is spartan, but the reception was pleasant. They told me I might need an ethernet cable but they were all out. As it turned out, in my room near the elevator, the wi-fi worked fine. They had coffee in the room and the lobby and a convenient junk-food/ water/ soda machine on each floor. I'd planned to stay at Hilgard House for this trip to UCLA, but they were sold out. They very kindly referred me to a few other hotels, including this one. I read the reviews, and found they were pretty favorable, so I booked it. On the whole, I was happy with this hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: NYCroadtrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, and have stayed at dozens of Holiday Inn Expresses around the country. Rooms are pretty clean, though the housekeeping staff can be a bit overzealous in trying to get into your room. The WiFi network is not great in all rooms, but works if you bring your laptop out into the courtyard (which can be noisy during breakfast). The front desk is probably the only complaint: they raised our rate from $129 to $159 when we tried to extend our stay. Only after talking with the Assistant GM where we able to keep our original rate.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel located at the busiest fwy entrance in LA”
Reviews.Author: bruce508
Reviews.Content: This review has one purpose: To communicate that this hotel/motel is located immediately on the busiest intersection perhaps in all of LA, at the Santa Monica blvd. entrance to the 405 fwy. If you're not from the area, this is like having a motel above the entrance to the Holland Tunnel. As I passed by this hotel, it appeared to be a very tall and thin building, constructed so that you would see the most of it from the fwy - and guess what, that their guests would get the most noise from the fwy. I notice the picture above has the fwy airbrushed out. Seeing as how this is the busiest fwy in LA, now being widened to 10 lanes, I'm not sure this is a "small detail" that it is OK to not mention. I have not stayed at this place - I wouldn't do it for $3000. I just imagine getting a room next to the fwy and horns waking me at 5:00 AM, or ealier, when I have a big presentation to give the next day. I also think of the many experiences I have in bad motels elsewhere: The A/C is too loud to sleep with, but when you open the window, some other noise makes it too loud to sleep that way. If you want to stay there, ask them if they will guarantee a quiet room and A/C, and back the guarantee with promise of a cash refund. Maybe they have great soundproofing and super-quiet A/C - I don't know. It just seems to me, the idea of building a hotel next to, and I mean immediately next to, the busiest fwy and onramp anywhere is just so nakedly uncaring, even contemptuous of guests, it is just unimaginable to me. I have no idea what Holiday Inn was thinking, or how they can live with themselves pulling something like this. If you do stay here, please please report back in detail on the noise. Are there good rooms and bad rooms do you think? Other travelers will definitely want to know! -Bruce G.

Reviews.Title: “Used to Love it - but they Lost their heart”
Reviews.Author: Skabooch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property over 20 times for business reasons. Though it is not flashy the rooms are nice, recently upgraded and the rooms are clean. I would have given this a 4-5 star review if management had not unceremoniously yanked the hotel general manager - Rodney. As a 20-year traveler for business who has stayed at many a Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, etc, I was amazed at the level of attentiveness that Rodney showed on guests. After the first visit, he knew my name on site. I watched how he handled guest, made the hotel run smooth. Holiday Inn took over the hotel early in '06 from Best Western, and I suppose there was some mid-level corporate flak who decided he knew what was best - but boy did they blow it here. This hotel will never be the same. It's still cheap and loud but cozy, and now it lost its soul.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express West Los Angeles
HotelInfo.Address: 11250 Santa Monica Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90025
